oai_dc:dc.dc:title: East Tennessee & Georgia Railroad Company Currency
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Currency number 1821 from the East Tennessee & Georgia Railroad Company for ten cents. From Knoxville, Tennessee dated 20 June 1862. Formerly the Hiawassee Railroad (Chartered 4 July 1836), the name was changed to the East Tennessee & Georgia Railroad Company on 4 February 1848 and then merged with the East Tennessee & Virginia Railroad in 1869 to become the East Tennessee, Virginia, and Georgia Railroad.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Currency; Railroad companies; Money;
